title: How many protons does an ion with 18 electrons and a charge of 2 contain? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, if it has got 18 electrons, (almost) massless, negatively-charged particles, and a charge of , then surely there are 16 massive, fundamental, positively-charged particles, the which we call protons? And thus  is UNEQUIVOCALLY specified; so what element has ? And we can identify the ion as sulfide, . Why?
you have p protons of charge +1, and 18 electrons of charge -1 the total charge is p - 18 = +2 then p = 20 protons
